notes: Wallpaper: 800x480 JPG/PNG recommended. Touch screen model.

configurable_options.name: phone_setting.keyboard_lock
configurable_options.label: Enable Phone Lock
configurable_options.description: Enable the phone lock feature to prevent unauthorized use. When enabled, the phone will lock after a period of inactivity and require a PIN to unlock. Useful for restricting access in shared or public spaces.

configurable_options.name: phone_setting.keyboard_lock.type
configurable_options.label: Lock Type
configurable_options.description: Choose which keys are locked when phone lock is active. Option 0 locks ALL keys including dial pad (complete lockdown). Option 1 locks menu/settings keys but allows dialing emergency numbers or specific extensions.

options.1: Lock all except dial pad (allow dialing)

configurable_options.name: phone_setting.keyboard_lock.password
configurable_options.label: Unlock PIN
configurable_options.description: The numeric PIN code required to unlock the phone (up to 15 digits). Choose a secure PIN that's easy to remember but hard to guess. Default is 1234 - strongly recommended to change this!

configurable_options.name: phone_setting.keyboard_lock.timeout
configurable_options.label: Auto-Lock Timeout (seconds)
configurable_options.description: Number of seconds of inactivity before the phone automatically locks itself. Set to 0 to disable auto-lock (manual lock only). Recommended: 60-300 seconds for public/hotel use, higher for office environments.

configurable_options.name: features.enhanced_dss_keys.enable
configurable_options.label: Enable Enhanced DSS Keys
configurable_options.description: Enable enhanced Direct Station Selection (DSS) keys for advanced button programming. Allows line keys to have additional features like BLF (Busy Lamp Field), speed dial, intercom, and more. Keep enabled unless experiencing compatibility issues.

configurable_options.name: softkey.1.enable
configurable_options.label: Enable Menu Softkey
configurable_options.description: Show or hide the 'Menu' softkey on the phone screen. Disable (set to 0) to prevent users from accessing settings and configuration menus - ideal for kiosks, hotel rooms, or child-restricted environments. Enable (set to 1) for normal administrative access.

configurable_options.name: softkey.1.label
configurable_options.label: Menu Softkey Label
configurable_options.description: Custom text label for the Menu softkey button. Only visible if Menu Softkey is enabled. You can rename it to something less obvious like 'Admin' or 'Setup' to reduce tampering attempts.

configurable_options.name: static.security.admin_password
configurable_options.label: Admin Password
configurable_options.description: Password for accessing the phone's web interface and advanced settings menu. CRITICAL SECURITY: Change this immediately! Default passwords are publicly known and make your phone vulnerable to unauthorized configuration changes.

configurable_options.name: static.network.web_server.enable
configurable_options.label: Enable Web Interface
configurable_options.description: Enable or disable the phone's built-in web interface (accessed via browser at phone's IP address). Disable (set to 0) for maximum security lockdown in public/hotel settings - phone can ONLY be configured via auto-provisioning. WARNING: Requires factory reset to re-enable!

configurable_options.name: static.zero_touch.enable
configurable_options.label: Enable Zero Touch Provisioning
configurable_options.description: Enable Yealink's Zero Touch auto-provisioning via RPS (Redirection and Provisioning Service). When enabled, phone attempts to get config from Yealink cloud servers on boot. Disable (set to 0) for security and to prevent accidental re-provisioning, especially in environments where users might power cycle devices.

configurable_options.name: phone_setting.backgrounds
configurable_options.label: Custom Wallpaper URL
configurable_options.description: URL where the phone can download a custom wallpaper image. Leave blank to use wallpaper set in Asset Manager. Format: http://server/path/wallpaper.jpg - must be accessible by the phone. Recommended size: 800x480 pixels for T48G.

configurable_options.name: screensaver.enable
configurable_options.label: Enable Screensaver
configurable_options.description: Enable screensaver to activate after idle period. Screensaver can display a clock, image slideshow, or blank screen. Useful to reduce screen burn-in and save power. Disable if you want the screen always active with call status visible.

configurable_options.name: screensaver.wait_time
configurable_options.label: Screensaver Wait Time (seconds)
configurable_options.description: Number of seconds of inactivity before screensaver activates. Default 300 seconds (5 minutes). Set lower for quick activation in hotel/public settings, or higher for office use where screen info is needed.

configurable_options.name: screensaver.type
configurable_options.label: Screensaver Type
configurable_options.description: Type of screensaver to display: 0=System default (usually clock), 1=Custom image, 2=Slideshow. Set to 1 and provide screensaver_upload_url for branded/custom screensaver images.

configurable_options.name: screensaver.upload_url
configurable_options.label: Screensaver Upload URL
configurable_options.description: URL where phone can download screensaver images. Format: http://server/path/ - phone will look for images named screensaver1.jpg, screensaver2.jpg, etc. Only used if screensaver.type is set to custom image or slideshow.

configurable_options.name: account.1.display_name
configurable_options.label: Display Name
configurable_options.description: Friendly name shown on the phone's display for this SIP account. This appears in the status bar, call history, and outgoing caller ID (if your SIP provider supports it). Examples: 'John Doe', 'Room 101', 'Front Desk'.

configurable_options.name: account.1.hotline_number
configurable_options.label: Hotline Number
configurable_options.description: Enable hotline/auto-dial feature. When set, phone automatically dials this number when handset is lifted or speakerphone pressed. Perfect for emergency phones, elevator phones, or single-purpose phones. Leave blank to disable. Use with hotline_delay to control dial timing.

configurable_options.name: account.1.hotline_delay
configurable_options.label: Hotline Delay (seconds)
configurable_options.description: Delay in seconds before hotline number is automatically dialed. 0 = immediate dial when handset lifted. 4 = wait 4 seconds (allows user to dial different number). Recommended: 0 for emergency phones, 3-4 for convenience hotlines.

configurable_options.name: phone_setting.inter_digit_timer
configurable_options.label: Inter-Digit Timeout (seconds)
configurable_options.description: How long the phone waits (in seconds) after the last digit is pressed before automatically dialing the number. Lower values = faster dialing but may cut off slow dialers. Higher values = more wait time between digits. Default: 2 seconds. Recommended: 1-2 for experienced users, 3-4 for elderly/inexperienced users.
